headline: What Nvidia's $5B investment in Intel means for its chip foundry
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) announced a $5 billion stake in Intel (INTC) alongside a joint partnership in developing artificial intelligence (AI) chips on Thursday. This happened while the US and the UK agreed to a $42 billion tech agreement — the Tech Prosperity Deal — during President Trump's visit to the UK, accompanied by Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang. Bernstein managing director and senior analyst Stacy Rasgon talks more about this new product partnership. Also catch what Moor Insights & Strategy's Patrick Moorhead has to say about this leading tech headline. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Intel Stock Surges on Nvidia Plan to Invest $5 Billion
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) will inject $5 billion into Intel (INTC) as part of a collaboration to jointly develop custom data-center and personal-computing products.  Nvidia will buy Intel stock at a purchase price of $23.28 a share.  Shares of Intel were up nearly one-quarter at $30.53 Thursday afternoon.

headline: Chip-maker Nvidia takes stake in rival Intel
summary: Shares in chipmaker Intel skyrocketed on Thursday after AI giant Nvidia announced it would invest $5 billion in its struggling rival.Nvidia joins Japanese investment giant SoftBank and the US government in backing the once-dominant chipmaker, which has fallen behind in recent years after missing key technology shifts.

raw.headline: Chip-maker Nvidia takes stake in rival Intel
raw.summary: Shares in chipmaker Intel skyrocketed on Thursday after AI giant Nvidia announced it would invest $5 billion in its struggling rival.Nvidia joins Japanese investment giant SoftBank and the US government in backing the once-dominant chipmaker, which has fallen behind in recent years after missing key technology shifts.

headline: Nvidia to Invest $5 Billion in Intel, Furthering Trump’s Turnaround Plan
summary: Nvidia  said it would invest $5 billion in  Intel  shares at a discount to yesterday’s closing price, the latest step in Intel’s efforts to revive its flagging fortunes.  Thursday’s agreement is a victory for Intel Chief Executive  Lip-Bu Tan,  who is in the middle of a high-wire turnaround effort backed by the Trump administration.  Thursday’s deal doesn’t cover Nvidia’s signature products, GPUs—graphics processing units—which are needed to train and fine-tune the world’s largest and most complex AI models.

raw.headline: Nvidia to Invest $5 Billion in Intel, Furthering Trump’s Turnaround Plan
raw.summary: Nvidia  said it would invest $5 billion in  Intel  shares at a discount to yesterday’s closing price, the latest step in Intel’s efforts to revive its flagging fortunes.  Thursday’s agreement is a victory for Intel Chief Executive  Lip-Bu Tan,  who is in the middle of a high-wire turnaround effort backed by the Trump administration.  Thursday’s deal doesn’t cover Nvidia’s signature products, GPUs—graphics processing units—which are needed to train and fine-tune the world’s largest and most complex AI models.

headline: U.K. Unveils Tech Partnerships on Trump Visit
summary: The president's visit this week underscores how Britain seems to have perfected the art of managing Trump.  The American president, unpopular in Britain, was kept away from the crowds, given a heavy dose of tightly choreographed British pageantry and the opportunity to ink a deal.  Several chief executives, including Jensen Huang of Nvidia, were in attendance.

headline: Here’s How Much the U.S. Has Made on Its Intel Stock Purchase
summary: Nvidia  shocked investors by taking a 5% stake in  Intel  —and the U.S. government is a big winner.  Last month, the federal government took a 433 million share stake in Intel at $20.47 a piece.  With Intel stock up 28.2% at $31.92 in midday trading, the government is up more than 55%, or $5 billion, on its “trade.”

headline: Here’s How Much the US Made on Its Intel Stock
summary: Nvidia  shocked investors by taking a 5% stake in  Intel  —and the U.S. government is a big winner.  With Intel stock up almost 26% at $31.27, the government is up more than 50%, or $4.7 billion, on its “trade.”  Nvidia shares were up 2.9% at $175.16, while the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average were up 0.7% and 0.5%, respectively.

headline: Intel Stock Soars 26% After Nvidia Invests in Chip Maker. What’s In It for Nvidia?
summary: Nvidia  said Thursday it would invest $5 billion in  Intel  at a purchase price of $23.28 a share as part of an agreement that will see the technology companies co-develop “multiple generations of custom data center and PC products.”  Intel  shares soared 26% to $31.27 following the announcement while  Nvidia  rose 3.1%.  Under the terms of the partnership, Intel will build custom central processing units that Nvidia will integrate into its artificial-intelligence infrastructure platforms and offer to the market.

raw.headline: Intel Stock Soars 26% After Nvidia Invests in Chip Maker. What’s In It for Nvidia?
raw.summary: Nvidia  said Thursday it would invest $5 billion in  Intel  at a purchase price of $23.28 a share as part of an agreement that will see the technology companies co-develop “multiple generations of custom data center and PC products.”  Intel  shares soared 26% to $31.27 following the announcement while  Nvidia  rose 3.1%.  Under the terms of the partnership, Intel will build custom central processing units that Nvidia will integrate into its artificial-intelligence infrastructure platforms and offer to the market.

headline: BRV Capital Invests in Zettabyte and Launches "TITAN" AIDC Project
summary: Zettabyte, the world's leading GPU infrastructure solutions provider, today announced a strategic investment from BRV Capital, a global technology private equity firm. The investment marks a significant milestone in the expansion of Zettabyte's global footprint and supports the launch of Zettabyte TITAN, a next-generation AI Data Center (AIDC) initiative designed to transform the availability, scalability, and efficiency of GPU-based computing worldwide.

headline: Rewiring Autonomy: PassiveLogic Raises $74 Million to Scale Physical AI in the Real World
summary: PassiveLogic, the category-defining pioneer in generative autonomy, today announces it has raised $74 million in Series C funding to scale its vision to meet global demand for physical AI in our everyday infrastructure. noa, Europe's largest built-world VC, led the round, joined by new investors, Prologis Ventures, Johnson Controls, and PSP Growth. They join existing backers Addition, NVentures (NVIDIA's venture capital arm), Keyframe, and Brookfield bringing total funding to over $125 million.

headline: Instant View: Nvidia's $5 billion bet on Intel
summary: Nvidia's support represents a new opening for Intel after years of turnaround efforts at the famed U.S. manufacturer failed to pay off.  Intel shares surged 30% in premarket action.  "Nvidia's $5 billion investment in Intel is less about money and more about influence."

headline: Magnificent Seven Tech Stocks Rally After Fed Rate Cut
summary: Each of the "Magnificent Seven" megacap tech stocks was rising on Thursday, buoyed by the Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates for the first time this year. The Roundhill Magnificent Seven exchange-traded fund, which trades under the ticker MAGS, climbed 1.

headline: Intel Stock Soars 28%. Nvidia to Invest $5 Billion in Chip Maker.
summary: Nvidia  said Thursday it would invest $5 billion in  Intel  at a purchase price of $23.28 a share as part of an agreement that will see the technology companies co-develop “multiple generations of custom data center and PC products.”  Intel  shares soared 28% to $31.80 following the announcement while  Nvidia  rose 3%.  Under the terms of the partnership, Intel will build custom central processing units that Nvidia will integrate into its artificial-intelligence infrastructure platforms and offer to the market.

raw.headline: Intel Stock Soars 28%. Nvidia to Invest $5 Billion in Chip Maker.

Under the terms of the partnership, Intel will build custom central processing units that Nvidia will integrate into its artificial-intelligence infrastructure platforms and offer to the market.

summary: Stock futures were rising Thursday after the Federal Reserve, as expected, trimmed interest rates by a quarter-point and signaled it could make two additional cuts this year.  Stocks rallied initially Wednesday f0llowing the Fed’s decision but finished the trading day mixed.  Intel  soared 30% to $32.25 after Nvidia said it would invest $5 billion in Intel at a purchase price of $23.28 a share as part of an agreement that will see the technology companies co-develop “multiple generations of custom data center and PC products.”.

headline: How Recent Developments Are Shaping the NVIDIA Investment Story
summary: The consensus analyst price target for NVIDIA shifted only slightly in the most recent update, moving from $207.01 to $209.19. This modest adjustment comes as bullish analysts cite sustained, outsized demand for NVIDIA’s AI compute products and upcoming new product cycles. Others point to rising competition and high market expectations as potential limiting factors. Stay tuned to see how ongoing developments and market responses could shape the narrative for NVIDIA’s stock in the months...
